title: M*A*S*H* = Mash (Captioned)
creator_contributor_role: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, production company
viewing_guidelines: CAPTIONED: suitable for hearing impaired viewers
subject_group: Literature/American literature - Film and video adaptations
Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/Anti-war works
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Medical care
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Medical personnel
description: Hailed as one of the best comedies ever made! Army surgeons during the Korean War develop a lunatic lifestyle in order to cope with the everyday horrors encountered in a Mobile Army Surgical Hospital. The film mixes slapstick with tragedy and pokes merciless fun at military pomposity, empty religion and incompetence. It sticks its tongue out at hypocrisy - the same attitudes which have mad the television series so successful. Based on a novel by Richard Hooker, the film stars Donald Sutherland, Elliott Gould and Tom Skerritt.
